Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 09:48AM ross wrote: Dear all: the information on this forum is great. My wife is 36 years old. She felt a lump in her left breast on October. Mammogram did not find anything. Ultra sound did not find any pathology, however, they say the lump that the doctor felt. She then proceeded to go to a specialist where she took a needle aspiration and results were not inconclusive. the specialist took a biopsy (day surgery). the found a typical cell in the duct. today is april 18th and she has a surgery to remove the lesion on April 25th. My wife is healthy and her sister and mother dont have cancer. Her grandfather died of prostate cancer. I have been reading a lot and I am not clear of what is next step. We have a consultation with the doctor one day before the surgery. any comments or help is much appreciated. We are in Toronto, Canada.
Posts.Title: What does having atypical cell really mean? Lolly BBJJBB
